unnormalised: The nation held its breath, folks, waiting for the ICC to drop the schedule for the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023. And boy, did they deliver! (Eventually. It felt like waiting for Halley's Comet, ngl.) The grand spectacle kicked off on 05/10/2023, with England locking horns with New Zealand. A rematch of the heart-stopping 2019 final! Cue dramatic music.
normalised: The nation held its breath, folks, waiting for the I-C-C to drop the schedule for the Men's Cricket World Cup two thousand and twenty three. And boy, did they deliver! (Eventually. It felt like waiting for Halley's Comet, not gonna lie.) The grand spectacle kicked off on fifth October two thousand and twenty three, with England locking horns with New Zealand. A rematch of the heart-stopping two thousand and nineteen final! Cue dramatic music.

unnormalised: Of course, all eyes were on the Men in Blue. India's first match was on 08/10/2023 against Australia. At 2:00 PM sharp. You know, just in time for a post-lunch nap... or, if you're truly dedicated, to start prepping your World Cup bingo cards. (I'm already predicting a Bumrah hat-trick. Don't @ me.)
normalised: Of course, all eyes were on the Men in Blue. India's first match was on eighth October two thousand and twenty three against Australia. At two PM sharp. You know, just in time for a post-lunch nap... or, if you're truly dedicated, to start prepping your World Cup bingo cards. (I'm already predicting a Bumrah hat-trick. Don't at me.)

unnormalised: The Indo-Pak clash? Oh, that wasn't just a cricket match, my friends. That was practically a national holiday! It was scheduled for 14/10/2023 initially, but thanks to Navratri festivities, they preponed it to 14/10/23. 2:00 PM IST. So now, instead of dancing to garba tunes, we got to scream at our TV screens. Talk about cultural integration.
normalised: The Indo-Pak clash? Oh, that wasn't just a cricket match, my friends. That was practically a national holiday! It was scheduled for fourteenth October two thousand and twenty three initially, but thanks to Navratri festivities, they preponed it to fourteenth October two thousand and twenty three. Two PM I-S-T. So now, instead of dancing to garba tunes, we got to scream at our T-V screens. Talk about cultural integration.

unnormalised: And speaking of rescheduling, let's not forget the mad scramble when some venues were deemed... less than ideal. It's like planning a grand wedding and realizing the caterer forgot the main course. Chaos! But hey, at least the revised schedule gave us more time to perfect our game-day outfits. (My "Bleed Blue" saree is ready, are you?)
normalised: And speaking of rescheduling, let's not forget the mad scramble when some venues were deemed... less than ideal. It's like planning a grand wedding and realizing the caterer forgot the main course. Chaos! But hey, at least the revised schedule gave us more time to perfect our game-day outfits. (My "Bleed Blue" saree is ready, are you?)

unnormalised: The semi-finals happened on 15/11/2023 and 16/11/2023, with the final match taking place on 19/11/2023. Can you believe it wrapped up so fast? Felt like yesterday we were discussing the chances of rain washing out key games!
normalised: The semi-finals happened on fifteenth November two thousand and twenty three and sixteenth November two thousand and twenty three, with the final match taking place on nineteenth November two thousand and twenty three. Can you believe it wrapped up so fast? Felt like yesterday we were discussing the chances of rain washing out key games!

unnormalised: So, as we look back at the whole drama (and the cricket, of course), one thing is clear: planning a major sporting event in India is an extreme sport in itself. Kudos to the organizers for somehow pulling it off. Until the next World Cup, folks – may your chai be strong and your predictions accurate! (And may the umpires have working eyeballs. Just sayin'.)
normalised: So, as we look back at the whole drama (and the cricket, of course), one thing is clear: planning a major sporting event in India is an extreme sport in itself. Kudos to the organizers for somehow pulling it off. Until the next World Cup, folks – may your chai be strong and your predictions accurate! (And may the umpires have working eyeballs. Just saying'.)

unnormalised: The next big date on the horizon? Well, the Paris Olympics 2024 opening ceremony is slated for 26/07/2024. So mark your calendars. We're going for gold, people! And hopefully, the schedule will be released at a more reasonable hour this time. Maybe even with a free samosa. One can dream, right?
normalised: The next big date on the horizon? Well, the Paris Olympics two thousand and twenty four opening ceremony is slated for twenty sixth July two thousand and twenty four. So mark your calendars. We're going for gold, people! And hopefully, the schedule will be released at a more reasonable hour this time. Maybe even with a free samosa. One can dream, right?
